intro: Haplopappus sphaerocephalus, commonly known as the globe thistle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features a short, upright stem with narrow, blue-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its spherical, blue-purple flower heads consist of numerous small florets arranged in a tight cluster. Haplopappus sphaerocephalus is known for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils in full sun.
